thread.title: Proto Labs to acquire Alphaform and expand additive manufacturing presence in Europe
thread.title_full: Proto Labs to acquire Alphaform and expand additive manufacturing presence in Europe

title: Proto Labs to acquire Alphaform and expand additive manufacturing presence in Europe
text:
Proto Labs to acquire Alphaform and expand additive manufacturing presence in Europe 24 September 2015 Print Proto Labs has today announced that it has reached agreement in principle to acquire select assets and operations of Germany company Alphaform AG, subject to standard terms and conditions of purchase. 
The world-leading manufacturer of custom parts and prototypes plans to expand its additive manufacturing presence in Europe through the acquisition of the leading service bureau headquartered in Feldkirchen (Munich), and is expected to be completed in early October. 
The planned acquisition will include Alphaform divisions operating in Germany, Finland, and the United Kingdom. This acquisition will significantly expand Proto Labs’ additive manufacturing capabilities in Europe by adding selective laser sintering, direct metal laser sintering and additional stereolithography capabilities. The acquisition also includes the injection moulding service currently offered by Alphaform Claho, in Eschenlohe, Germany. MediMet Precision Casting and Implants Technology GmbH, a 100% subsidiary of Alphaform AG is not part of the transaction. 
“We are pleased to announce this strategic acquisition which will accelerate the growth of our Additive Manufacturing services in Europe and complement our current Injection Melding and CNC Machining services,” Vicki Holt, President and CEO at Proto Labs, explained. “With those three complementary offerings, we’re uniquely positioned to help designers and engineers take a product from the initial stages of prototyping through low-volume production.” × Expand 
Proto Labs now offers AM services. 
Proto Labs recently announced the launch of its advanced additive manufacturing service offering stereolithography services for custom prototyping and low-volume production. The company plans to expand this further with the introduction of selective laser sintering and direct metal laser sintering processes in 2016. Both technologies have already been successfully established at Proto labs’ locations in the US. 
Proto Labs will exhibit at TCT Show + Personalize on 30 th September – 1 st October 2015 at the NEC, Birmingham. Visitors can register for free and find out more about Proto Labs latest developments on booth F26. Tags
